page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY-IRONBRIDGE
page.content: {BUILDWAS ABBEY,a Cistercian house, was built by Roger De Clinton in 1135. The monks were a farming community. Since 1925 the Department of the Environment has cared for the ruins. In 1708{Abraham Darby 1}came to Coalbrookdale. In 1709, he first smelted iron, using coke not charcoal, because the wood was needed for ships, buildings and houses. Shropshire coal was good for coke because it didn't contain sulphur. At first, Coalbrookdale iron was only suitable for casting because it contained too much phosphorus for wrought iron, but by{1750, Abraham {Darby 2}had solved the problem. He increased production in the furnaces by using a Newcomen engine to pump water to 10 waterwheels. In 1775{Abraham Darby 3}was in a group planning a Severn bridge.
